qas.question: Who was the ideologue of the Iranian Revolution?
Mohammad Iqbal was what type of father to the State of Pakistan?
Where does Khomeini's beliefs fall as compared to Mawdudi and Qutb?
Who was it essential to Islam to imitate?
What long term agenda was the acts of plundering Muslim lands by the West?
Who was not the ideologue of the Iranian Revolution?
Mohammad Iqbal was what type of enemy to the State of Pakistan?
Who was it essential for Islam to not imitate?
hat long term agenda was the acts of plundering Muslim lands by the East?

context: The views of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>Ali Shariati<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, ideologue of the Iranian Revolution, had resemblance with Mohammad Iqbal, <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>ideological<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> father of the State of Pakistan, but Khomeini's beliefs is perceived to be placed <a2_0><a2_2>somewhere <a2_1>between<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> beliefs of Sunni Islamic thinkers like Mawdudi and Qutb. He believed that complete imitation of <a3_0>the <a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>Prophet Mohammad<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_0/> and his successors<a3_1/> such as Ali for restoration of Sharia law was essential to Islam, that many secular, <a4_1>Westernizing Muslims<a4_1/> were actually agents of the West serving Western interests, and that the acts such as "plundering" of Muslim lands was part of a long-term <a4_0><a4_2><b8_0>conspiracy<b8_0/><a4_2/><a4_0/> against Islam by the Western governments.
